io.prometheus.client.metrics

Class Gauge.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.prometheus.client.metrics.Gauge.Builder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>
    Enclosing class:
    Gauge

    public static class Gauge.Builder
extends Object
implements Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>

    Define the characteristics for this Gauge.

    Implementation-Specific Behaviors:

    • If the metric and its children are reset, a default value of 0 is used.

    For all other behaviors, see Metric.BaseBuilder.

    • Method Detail

      • labelNames

        public Gauge.Builder labelNames(String... ds)
        Description copied from interface: Metric.Builder

        Declare this metric's label names.

        A label is used as a facet for aggregation or pivoting in data. If you were a census technician building a system to show the current number of people in a given postal code at a given time, you could create a label called "postal_code".

        Important: Children of this metric must be instantiated with all of the declared labels. Failure to do so will result in a runtime error due to a programming error.

        Specified by:
        labelNames in interface Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>
        Returns:
        A copy of the original Metric.Builder with the new target value.

      • name

        public Gauge.Builder name(String n)
        Description copied from interface: Metric.Builder

        Required: Assign this metric a name.

        A name is a distinct component that is measured, such as temperature.

        For example, you have provided Metric's Metric.BaseBuilder with the following parameters:

        • namespace = "seaworld"
        • subsystem = "water_heaters"
        • name = "efficiency_percentage"
        The Metric's naming system generates the following composite metric name: seaworld_water_heaters_efficiency_percentage . The name is efficiency_percentage.

        Specified by:
        name in interface Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>
        Returns:
        A copy of the original Metric.Builder with the new target value.

      • subsystem

        public Gauge.Builder subsystem(String ss)
        Description copied from interface: Metric.Builder

        Associate this metric with a subsystem.

        A subsystem is a collection of systems that perform related units of work that might have multiple aspects against which they are measured.

        For example, you have provided Metric's Metric.BaseBuilder with the following parameters:

        • namespace = "seaworld"
        • subsystem = "water_heaters"
        • name = "efficiency_percentage"
        The Metric's naming system generates the following composite metric name: seaworld_water_heaters_efficiency_percentage . The subsystem is water_heaters.

        Specified by:
        subsystem in interface Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>
        Returns:
        A copy of the original Metric.Builder with the new target value.

      • namespace

        public Gauge.Builder namespace(String ns)
        Description copied from interface: Metric.Builder

        Associate this metric with a namespace.

        A namespace is the ownership scope of a metric, such as an organization, company, or work group.

        For example, you have provided Metric's Metric.BaseBuilder with the following parameters:

        • namespace = "seaworld"
        • subsystem = "water_heaters"
        • name = "efficiency_percentage"
        The Metric's naming system generates the following composite metric name: seaworld_water_heaters_efficiency_percentage. The namespace is seaworld.

        Specified by:
        namespace in interface Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>
        Returns:
        A copy of the original Metric.Builder with the new target value.

      • registerStatic

        public Gauge.Builder registerStatic(boolean rs)
        Description copied from interface: Metric.Builder

        Instructs Prometheus to register this metric upon its creation.

        Important: This defaults to true. If more than one metric of the same (full name, docstring) is registered, the first one wins.

        The following are use cases for setting this to true:

        • Runtimes where runtime-retained annotations neither respected nor supported, meaning Register cannot be used and you wish to not explicitly register the metrics yourself.

        The following are use cases for setting this to false:

        • Preventing static side-effects from tests.
        • Respecting dependency injection paradigms. Be sure to explicitly use Prometheus.defaultRegister(Metric).

        Specified by:
        registerStatic in interface Metric.Builder<Gauge.Builder,Gauge>
        Returns:
        A copy of the original Metric.Builder with the new target value.

      • defaultValue

        public Gauge.Builder defaultValue(Double v)

        Provide a custom default value for this Gauge when it undergoes a Metric.resetAll() or a specific Gauge.Child undergoes a Gauge.Child.reset().

        Returns:
        A copy of the original Gauge.Builder with the new target value.
